_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: A geodetic datum is an abstract coordinate system with a reference surface (such as sea level) that serves to provide known locations to begin surveys and create maps.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng: A *geodetic datum* or *geodetic system* (also: *geodetic reference datum*, *geodetic reference system*, or *geodetic reference frame*) is a global [datum reference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Datum_reference
) for precisely representing the position of [locations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Location
) or other planetary bodies by means of *[geodetic coordinates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geodetic_coordinates

Because of their relative simplicity, [reference ellipsoids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reference_ellipsoid) are used as a preferred surface on which [geodetic network](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geodetic_network
)computations are performed and point coordinates such as [latitude](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latitude

) are defined.

In the context of standardization and geographic applications, a *geodesic reference ellipsoid* is the mathematical model used as foundation by [spatial reference system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spatial_reference_system

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: WGS-84 Equatorial radius minus the specified datum Equatorial radius in meters.
WGS-84 flattening minus the specified datum flattening multiplied by 10^4.
Delta X, Y, Z parameters are WGS-84 X, Y, Z parameters minus the specified datum X, Y, Z in meters.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng: The Delta X, Y, and Z parameters are added to the specified datum X, Y, Z to convert to WGS-84.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Delta X, Y, Z parameters are WGS-84 X, Y, Z parameters minus the specified datum X, Y, Z in meters.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng: The Delta X, Y, and Z parameters are added to the specified datum X, Y, Z to convert to WGS-84.

_info_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Delta X, Y, Z parameters are WGS-84 X, Y, Z parameters minus the specified datum X, Y, Z in meters.

_info_description.iso_639_3_eng: The Delta X, Y, and Z parameters are added to the specified datum X, Y, Z to convert to WGS-84.
